facts: A man survived two atomic bombs - Tsutomu Yamaguchi was in Hiroshima for work, returned to Nagasaki, and survived both blasts.
Violet Jessop survived the sinking of both the Titanic and its sister ship, the Britannic.
A Japanese soldier named Hiroo Onoda continued fighting WWII until 1974, 29 years after it ended, because he didn't know it was over.
In 1971, a man hijacked a plane, parachuted out with $200,000, and was never found. The case remains unsolved.
A woman fell 33,000 feet without a parachute and survived after landing in a snow-covered mountainside.
